result.markdown:
# Graphs


::: {.cell}

:::


## Scatterplots

::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}

### Stata

#### Get The Data


::: {.cell collectcode='true'}

```{.stata .cell-code}

use simulated_multilevel_data.dta

```
:::


#### Scatterplot


::: {.cell}

```{.stata .cell-code}
twoway scatter outcome warmth, ///
  xtitle("warmth") ytitle("outcome") ///
  title("Outcome by Parental Warmth") 

quietly graph export scatter.png, replace

```
:::


![Outcome by Parental Warmth (Stata)](scatter.png){#fig-Stata}

### R

#### Get The Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(haven)

df <- read_dta("simulated_multilevel_data.dta")
```
:::


#### Scatterplot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(df,
       aes(x = warmth,
           y = outcome)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Outcome by Parental Warmth")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Outcome by Parental Warmth (R)](graphs_files/figure-html/fig-R-1.png){#fig-R width=672}
:::
:::


### Julia

#### Get The Data


::: {.cell}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using Tables, MixedModels, StatFiles, DataFrames, CategoricalArrays, DataFramesMeta

df = DataFrame(load("simulated_multilevel_data.dta"))
```
:::


#### Scatterplot


::: {.cell}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using StatsPlots

@df df scatter(:warmth, :outcome, 
               title = "Outcome by Parental Warmth",
               ylabel = "outcome",
               xlabel = "parental warmth")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Outcome by Parental Warmth (Julia)](graphs_files/figure-html/fig-Julia-J1.png){#fig-Julia width=300}
:::
:::


:::

## Line Graph

::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}

### Stata

#### Get The Data 


::: {.cell collectcode='true'}

```{.stata .cell-code}

use simulated_multilevel_longitudinal_data.dta

```
:::


#### Line Graph


::: {.cell}

```{.stata .cell-code}
twoway lfit outcome t, ///
  xtitle("time") ytitle("outcome") ///
  title("Outcome by Time") 

quietly graph export lfitlongitudinal.png, replace

```
:::


![Outcome by Parental Warmth (Stata)](lfitlongitudinal.png){#fig-Statalongitudinal}

### R

#### Get The Data 


::: {.cell collectcode='true'}

```{.stata .cell-code}

use simulated_multilevel_longitudinal_data.dta

```
:::


#### Line Graph


::: {.cell}

```{.stata .cell-code}
twoway lfit outcome t, ///
  xtitle("time") ytitle("outcome") ///
  title("Outcome by Time") 

quietly graph export lfitlongitudinal.png, replace

```
:::


![Outcome by Parental Warmth (Stata)](lfitlongitudinal.png){#fig-Statalongitudinal}

### Julia

#### Get The Data


::: {.cell}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using Tables, MixedModels, StatFiles, DataFrames, CategoricalArrays, DataFramesMeta

dfL = DataFrame(load("simulated_multilevel_longitudinal_data.dta"))
```
:::


#### Line Graph

To make our plot with a smoother in Julia, we set the `markercolor` and `markerstrokecolor` to be *white*, and the `smooth` option to `:true`.


::: {.cell}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using StatsPlots

@df dfL scatter(:t, :outcome, 
               title = "Outcome by Time",
               ylabel = "outcome",
               xlabel = "time",
               markercolor = "white",
               markerstrokecolor = "white",
               smooth=:true)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Outcome by Parental Warmth (Julia)](graphs_files/figure-html/fig-Julialongitudinal-J1.png){#fig-Julialongitudinal width=300}
:::
:::


:::

## Spaghetti Plots

::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}

### Stata


::: {.cell}

```{.stata .cell-code}
spagplot outcome t, ///
  id(country)
  xtitle("time") ytitle("outcome") ///
  title("Outcome by Time") 

quietly graph export spagplot.png, replace

```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
command xtitle is unrecognized
r(199);

r(199);
```


:::
:::


![Outcome by Parental Warmth (Stata)](spagplot.png){#fig-Stataspagplot}

### Julia
